intro: Aster chrysanthemifolius, commonly known as the goldenleaf aster, is a herbaceous perennial native to the eastern United States. It features dark green, lance-shaped leaves with a slightly hairy texture, and its flowers are typically yellow or white, arranged in dense, flat clusters. The plant thrives in moist, well-drained soils and prefers partial to full sun. It is often found in wetlands, stream banks, and other riparian habitats. Its botanical characteristics make it an important species for ecological studies and wetland restoration projects.
